Gondi_Mu is irregular (*hīkaṛwould be expected), probably re-borrowed from another dialect.

Notes: External data makes us regard-umhere as part of the root.
Whether we should rely on Gondi_FH and reconstruct an initial*y-or not, is highly questionable.

Word: ēr- "(crossroads) to divide, spread out in different directions"

Additional forms: Simple form in all dialectsēnd-to dance

Word: goṭṭa "small wooden case for carrying tobacco"

Notes: The original quality of the vowel has been preserved in Gondi_S (īn<*iv-n) and Gondi_Ch, which alone of all dialects has preserved some traces of-v-in its former position:iyel<*iv-l<*iv-nR. In most other dialects vowel quality has been modified, and some preserved the original-v-by means of a metathese.
Forms with-kare actually plural forms.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Tryeh-gatāthe water gnat;yeha-kkorrthe diving grebe; Gondi_W, Gondi_Phetkthirst
Notes: The form 'thirst' should be reconstructed as*etk.
In Gondi_Mukaraṭiwe see the original-r-that has fallen out everywhere else in the cluster*-rnḍ-; this also led to vowel lengthening.
